name: spock
text: This is one of my favorites. I love the phrase "stiff coal."

name: deimosrising
text: Last panel is genius, you drink inadequately and incorrectly if this strip doesn't rule you.

name: tonyhighwind
text:
All paper umbrella in a drink that is pink. Tittering when you order a Sex on the Beach, thinking to yourself "OMG how naughty!"

All pronouncing OMG to yourself the way it is spelled.

name: helenthebum
text: A comment left by helenthebum was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by alphagator, Connellingus, farqussus, mystkmanat, Boyd, clintisiceman, STUART)

name: untilyouaresonude
text: I'd pay upwards of fifty dollars for a bottle of "Ancient Situation". Also, its cousin, "Ancient Shennanigan".

name: tellumo
text:
I believe Ancient Situation/Shenanigan is the name under which Ancient Age is marketed to the Underground consumer base .

Someone should fire up Photoshop and make a label.

name: twotonturkey
text: I'm still on the lookout for a bottle of Liquid Banjo myself.

name: stuart
text: And here I am thinking I'm clever

name: poodlelucy
text: don't forget "Ancient Circumstances"

name: scorpio_nadir
text: All my Shenanigans can now be considered 'ancient','heirloom' even, but my Situation is Currently Improving.

name: zem
text: A comment left by zem was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by dennycrane, Connellingus, farqussus, doomsdaybadger, morbo)

name: tombsgrave
text: The thought of picking a fight with a meat packing plant is both horrifying and awesome.  I'd play a video game where one of the bosses was a meat packing plant.  A mobile, pissed-off meat packing plant whom you stole the liquor of.

name: epicurus
text: Someone seriously needs to make that. I think Rockstar would probably take that project.

name: stuart
text: woah hey, 6 months later and i realize i never mentioned that I made this game. (the meat packing plant doesn't move because i was being a stupid lazy freshman and had to cut a lot of plans short, like for instance an ending) i'll see if digipen ever lets me post it.

name: leggotheego
text: You know Gusano Rojo is actually not that bad

name: dicklaurent
text:
It is difficult to find a good equivalent of "ankle drunk" in Norwegian, so I just translated that directly.
[img=http://img524.imageshack.us/img524/5630/achewoodnorskvn1.gif]

name: dicklaurent
anitrophaeron
text: Hvorfor vil du skrive på Norsk?

name: dicklaurent
text: Onstad mener at posten ikke kan oversettes til et annet språk, og jeg tok utfordringen. And by the way, I meant to reply to  Zefiel's post, which was much more appropriate. In my excitement, I posted it above his. I am sorry about this.

name: stormagnet
text: ...and I read it, in my innocence.

name: achilleselbow
text: I don't know what it means, but I'm pretty sure your second sentence is the title of a black metal song by Old Man's Child.

name: dicklaurent
text: "og jeg tok utfordringen" means "I took the challenge". We may have something here

name: profbobo
unfun
text: HECHO EN MEXICO

name: envika
text: It does not make you drunk, it makes you the way you THINK you are when you're drunk.

name: boredom_man
text: Hrm. I would say that a mescal-drunk is drunk, and all other drunkenness is a parody thereof.

name: boscostacy
text: Invincible and the sexiest man on earth?

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Definitely NOT afraid of the fucking Police now!

name: mercuri0us
text: Really, because when I'm drunk I think I'm pretty awesome, so maybe I should try some.

name: desert_donkey
text:
total touristy poseur Quote:
"Look what I got in Mexico! It's like Tequilla and has a real worm in it!! [i]Ewww!![i] Gross!!"
.

fucking thing isn't even opened. saving for a special day or what?

name: everything_is_a_hat
text: get your gusana rojo mezcal here

name: centipede_damascus
text: I'm definitely not afraid of the POLICE right now!

name: mashuren
text: This strip would be very difficult to translate into a foreign language.

name: zefiel
text:
Difficult yes, but not impossible. Ha!




(that's Mexican spanish. Only fitting, yes?)

name: tellumo
text: Awesome. I only have a couple of questions: what do "alcohol del 96" and "teporochos" mean in the second panel? I can make sense of pretty much everything else (and a Chubby with Oak Leaf Cluster for "alcohol del barrio" and Beef's line in the last panel), but I can't piece together what those would mean without the original translation and/or context. But then again, yo hablo el español como un gringo borracho.

name: zefiel
text: Hey, hello. Thanks for the interest! Alcohol del 96 is basically rubbing alcohol. A Teporocho is a wino. In fact, I just started a blog i think you could be interested in.

name: singtralala
text: jaja, bebida de teporochos.

name: laserblade
text: I could bring up a couple grammatical issues, but this is the Internet, where people are polite to each other and never point out such things.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Man, I just started browsing through the 4.4 strips when I saw this come up, and  I couldn't believe it was so low (relatively).  I went right to it, determined to make my 5 bring it up a point, and, fuck yeah, it did.

name: cdtm
text: A comment left by cdtm was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by envika, gbeaton, sncether)

name: nokococo
text: You don't drink to feel better, you drink to piss off cops.

name: zebra
text:
This strip amazes me.

And fits my hangover.

name: heccibiggs
text:
I went to the Guzano Rojo Mezcal wiki page, and I noticed that there is no mention of Achewood in the references section. So I tried to edit it, but I've never edited a Wiki pge before and got scared and ran away.

Someone should go do it, though. It's important.

name: charchar
text: I tried to but I couldn't find it. I have failed you!

name: charchar
text: Also, Beef should know better than to strand a preposition (cf. panel 6) . It should read "What you LIKE is hat you are holding something for which the police will wrestle you. Sorry, but it had to be said.

name: mattylite
text: Stranded prepositions are just something up with which you won't put.

name: charchar
text: They just look so lonely...

name: mugi
text: This comment makes me happy.

name: boredom_man
text: Yeah, about that Charchar. You know how in high school they tell you not to end sentences with a preposition? In your first year of college they'll tell you that no legitimate publication has taken that rule seriously for about 150 years, and no publication outside of England ever did. Might as well hear it now.

name: charchar
text: The disillusionment in shattering.  I feel all broken up inside.

name: i_love_kate
text: Hahahahahahaha... hoo.

name: aelindil
text:
Especially if you're studying Linguistics. Then they also tell you that everything you ever believed about grammar is ridiculous and that you are ridiculous for believing it.

Pleased me to no end, I can tell you.

name: apricotta
text:
Hypercorrection sometimes results in clumsy and hilarious constructions.
Charchar: What are you on about? Oops, about what are you on... no, I mean, on about what are you?


Agent Bork: Chief! Ya know that guy whose camper they were whackin' off in?
Agent Fleming: Bork, you're a federal agent! You represent the United States Government! Never end a sentence with a preposition.
Agent Bork: Oh, uh... Ya know that guy in whose camper they... I... I mean, that guy off in whose camper they were whacking?

name: red-barchetta
text: My friend and I went to Puerto Vallarta a few years ago and on our first trip to the liquor store we grabbed this bottle as we felt it looked very "Mexican".  We shot the whole bottle with cerveza chasers and shortly thereafter my friend jumped up onto a retaining wall and shouted Viva Mexico! He then  fell off the wall and into some very scratchy bushes. It took us quite some time to get all the nettles out of his skin. Good times.

name: chachibenji
text: Never pick a fight with a group of men who put meat into packages.

name: desert_donkey
text: A comment left by desert_donkey was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by mikeronomicon, Mangtastic, Centipede_Damascus)

name: mikeronomicon
text: lamed in defense of crappy booze.

name: heccibiggs
text: Is the trick "don't bother, because why would you eat a worm?".

name: liithe
text: If anyone didn't know, Gusano Rojo means red worm

name: tbtabby
text: It's the evil Earth-3 version of Tequila.

name: andrewthepig
text:
This strip has the most insane metaphoric dialogue.

My god I love it.
